resources.string: Do you want to complete installation?
Are you sure? This action cannot be undone!
You can use InviZible Pro with local VPN mode, or applications with own proxy or local VPN feature in proxy mode.
You can use InviZible Pro with applications with own proxy or local VPN feature in proxy mode.
Use a delay (secs) only if Autostart does not work correctly
Sites list to open with Tor. This feature does not work for sites behind CDN
Applications list to use with Tor
Applications list to use with InviZible
Sites list to open directly. This feature does not work for sites behind CDN
Period in hours to refresh sites IP. For Android 5.1 and higher. Put 0 to stop refresh.
Use it if you can not connect to Tor network
Please disable Entry Nodes in Tor Settings, otherwise you cannot use Bridges.
New default Tor bridges are available. Do you want to update them?
Do not use Tor for LAN destinations and IANA reserved IP blocks
Show application connection logs in the DNS tab
Check InviZible Pro and modules updates daily
Check if new versions are available now
Check updates only with Tor and when Tor is running
Use Root privileges for DNSCrypt, Tor and I2P modules. Enabling this feature leaves modules unmanaged and may cause connection problems!
Deny connection to http port 80 for HOTSPOT
Protect application from being killed by android
Detect Man-in-the-Middle ARP spoofing and rogue DHCP attacks in Wi-Fi networks.
Detect Man-in-the-Middle rogue DHCP attacks in Wi-Fi networks.
Block internet when an attack is detected
Internet connection will be blocked during attack
Block site when DNS rebinding attack is detected
InviZible Pro will make all connections through the SOCKS5 proxy
Block internet connection when Tor, DNSCrypt and Purple I2P are stopped
Update rules on every connectivity change
Do not allow the device to fall into doze mode. May be useful when using HOTSPOT. Drains the battery!
Enable if your device with a custom rom and the connection is lost when you press the START button
Show all messages that have been marked as not allowed to show

Use the following command to manage application modules: \"am broadcast -a pan.alexander.tordnscrypt.SHELL_SCRIPT_CONTROL --ei dnscrypt 1 --ei tor 1 --ei i2p 1 %s\". Where 1 - starts, 0 - stops the module.

Please exclude InviZible Pro from Android battery optimization to prevent the system from terminating DNSCrypt, Tor, or I2P at any time. Some special systems, such as MIUI, may require additional steps.
Please allow background data usage and allow data usage while Data saver is on. This is essential for a smooth online experience.
Route All incoming traffic through Tor
Sites list to open with Tor for HOTSPOT
Sites list to open directly for HOTSPOT
TTL will be fixed to 64 using a local VPN. Kernel support is not required. To fix TTL please start DNSCrypt or/and Tor.
Enable Fix TTL and configure LAN device to connect to InviZible. Use default gateway: %1$s, DNS server: %2$s.
Support for Dual Apps, MIUI, Island, Shelter and Work profile applications. May be ineffective in VPN mode
Wait until the exclusive iptables lock can be obtained to prevent concurrent modification of iptables rules.
DNSCrypt, Tor, I2P are protected. Don\'t hide.
Internet blocked due to the Kill switch. Start Tor, DNSCrypt or I2P to allow the connection. Or disable the Kill switch in Common Settings.
Require servers (from static + remote sources) to satisfy specific properties
Use servers implementing the DNSCrypt protocol.
Use servers implementing the DNS-over-HTTPS protocol.
Use servers implementing the Oblivious DNS-over-HTTPS protocol.
Require servers defined by remote sources to satisfy specific properties
Server must support DNS security extensions (DNSSEC).
Server must not log user queries (declarative).
Server must not enforce its own blacklist (for parental control, ads blocking…).
Always use TCP to connect to upstream servers
Use TCP instead of UDP to connect to DNSCrypt servers. This option should be enabled if you are using DNSCrypt over Tor.
Route all TCP connections to a local Tor inbound Socks5 proxy. Tor doesn\'t support UDP, so set Force TCP to true as well.

This is a normal, non-encrypted DNS resolver, that will be only used for one-shot queries when retrieving the initial resolvers list, and only if the system DNS configuration doesn\'t work. It will never be used if lists have already been cached.
Do not let DNSCrypt try to use system DNS settings. Unconditionally use the Bootstrap resolvers.
Enable support for HTTP/3 (DoH3, HTTP over QUIC). Note that, like DNSCrypt but unlike other HTTP versions, this uses UDP and (usually) port 443 instead of TCP.
Activate this option if you are on an IPv6-only network and IPv4 sites become unavailable. Don\'t enable it otherwise, or you won\'t be able to connect to anything at all.
Set of used static IPv6 prefixes.
Route queries for specific domains to a dedicated set of servers.
Import a forwarding rules file. You can select multiple files, duplicate lines will be removed.
Cloaking returns a predefined address for a specific name. In addition to acting as a HOSTS file, it can also return the IP address of a different name. It will also do CNAME flattening.
Import a cloaking rules file. You can select multiple files, duplicate lines will be removed.
Log client queries to a file.
Do not log these query types, to reduce verbosity. Keep empty to log everything.
Log queries for nonexistent zones. These queries can reveal the presence of malware, broken/obsolete applications, and devices signaling their presence to 3rd parties.
Blacklist are made of one pattern per line.
Import a domain list or hosts file. You can select multiple files, duplicate lines will be removed.
IP Blacklist are made of one pattern per line.
Import IP blacklist. You can select multiple files, duplicate lines will be removed.
Whitelist support the same patterns as blacklists. If a name matches a whitelist entry, the corresponding session will bypass names and IP filters.
Import a domain list. You can select multiple files, duplicate lines will be removed.
Server list will be updated after the specified delay in hours.
Relay list will be updated after the specified delay in hours.
Preference does not exist in dnscrypt-proxy.toml!
Immediately respond to A and AAAA queries for host names without a domain name.
Immediately respond to queries for local zones instead of leaking them to upstream resolvers (always causing errors or timeouts).
Immediately respond to IPv6-related queries with an empty response. This makes things faster when there is no IPv6 connectivity, but can also cause reliability issues with some stub resolvers.
Please turn off \"Private DNS\" in Android network settings. This option interferes with InviZible.
Please disable proxy in Android WiFi network settings. This option interferes with InviZible.
Please disable proxy in Android Mobile network APN settings. This option interferes with InviZible.
Too many rules to display. Only the first 1000 is shown.
When Tor needs to assign a virtual (unused) address because of a MAPADDRESS command from the controller or the AutomapHostsOnResolve feature, Tor picks an unassigned address from this range.
Try to use built-in crypto hardware acceleration when available.
If non-zero, try to write to disk less frequently.
This option governs Tor’s use of padding to defend against some forms of traffic analysis. Disable to save bandwidth.
If set enabled, Tor will not hold OR connections open for very long, and will send less padding on these connections. Enable to save bandwidth.
A list of country codes to never use when picking an exit node, that delivers traffic for you outside the Tor network.
A list of country codes to use as exit node - that is, a node that delivers traffic for you outside the Tor network.
A list of country codes to avoid when building a circuit.
A list of country codes of nodes to use for the first hop in your normal circuits.
Disable Tor bridges if you want to select entry nodes.
If StrictNodes enabled, Tor will treat solely the ExcludeNodes option as a requirement to follow for all the circuits you generate, even if doing so will break functionality for you.
If enabled, Tor will only create outgoing connections to ORs running on ports that your firewall allows (defaults to 80 and 443).
To activate this option, you should disable bridges or use bridges with 80 and 443 ports only.
Every NUM seconds consider whether to build a new circuit.
Feel free to reuse a circuit that was first used at most NUM seconds ago, but never attach a new stream to a circuit that is too old.
Tor enters a dormant state if it does not see client activity for a specified time. Must be at least 10 minutes
If enabled, Tor will not put two servers whose IP addresses are "too close" on the same circuit. Currently, two addresses are "too close" if they lie in the same /16 range.
Open this port to listen for connections from SOCKS-speaking applications.
Open this port to listen for proxy connections using the "HTTP CONNECT" protocol instead of SOCKS.
Open this port to listen for transparent proxy connections.
Open this port to listen for UDP DNS requests, and resolve them anonymously.
If disable, Tor will avoid connecting to directory servers and entry nodes over IPv4.
If enabled, Tor might connect to directory servers or entry nodes over IPv6.
Preference does not exist in tor.conf!
Hides the broker\'s domain name from the Internet provider. The broker is used to establish a connection.
Tor will make all OR connections through the SOCKS 5 proxy.
Tor will track recent connections to hosts and attempt to reuse the same exit node for each. This option may help avoid endless captcha.
Don’t share circuits with streams from different apps.
Don’t share circuits with streams targeting a different destination address.
Don’t share circuits with streams targeting a different destination port.
Port to listen for incoming connections (default: auto (random)).
Router external IP for incoming connections (default: auto if SSU2 is enabled).
Router will not accept transit tunnels, disabling transit traffic completely.
Max % of bandwidth limit for transit. 0–100.
Specify proxy server for NTCP. Should be http://address:port or socks://address:port.
The port to listen on (HTTP Proxy).
HTTP proxy upstream out proxy url (like http://false.i2p)
The port to listen on (SOCKS Proxy).
Address of outproxy(IP or local). Requests outside I2P will go there.
Override maximum number of transit tunnels. 2500 by default.
Limit number of open file descriptors (0 - use system limit).
Maximum size of core file in Kb (0 - use system limit).
AddressBook subscription URL for initial setup.
Looks like DNSCrypt was killed by android system. Your internet connection was restored. Check device Settings!
Looks like Tor was killed by android system. Your internet connection was restored. Check device Settings!
Looks like I2P was killed by android system. Check device Settings!
Looks like DNSCrypt can\'t connect to the internet. You can try to choose another DNSCrypt servers. Please find them in MENU -> Fast Settings -> Select DNSCrypt servers
Looks like Tor can\'t connect to the internet. ISP may blocks Tor connections. You can try to use Tor Bridges. Please find them in MENU -> Fast Settings -> Bridges
You can lock control of this application. Please enter password, or use previous.
Logs Saved. Please send InvizibleLogs.txt to developer. You can find logs in the folder:
Some of InviZible modules are ready for update. Do you want to update its? This will overwrite your modules settings!
Please restart InviZible Pro and allow complete installation! After installation reconfigure HOTSPOT, if you use it!
Copyright (C) 2019-2024 Garmatin Oleksandr\n All Rights Reserved\n Web Site:

\tInviZible Pro does not collect or share any personal or sensitive user data. InviZible Pro forwards internet traffic directly to Tor, DNSCrypt and I2P networks. For detailed information, please visit the official pages of the mentioned projects.

\tInviZible Pro is free software: you can redistribute it and/or modify it under the terms of the GNU General Public License as published by the Free Software Foundation, either version 3 of the License, or (at your option) any later version.\n\t InviZible Pro is distributed in the hope that it will be useful, but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. See the GNU General Public License for more details.\n\t You should have received a copy of the GNU General Public License along with InviZible Pro. If not, see http://www.gnu.org/licenses
InviZible Pro update is available. Do you want to download and update it? The update will continue in the background.
DNSCrypt update is available. Do you want to download and update it? The update will continue in the background.
Tor update is available. Do you want to download and update it? The update will continue in the background.
Purple I2P update is available. Do you want to download and update it? The update will continue in the background.
Please wait while updates are checking.
The update server is temporarily unavailable. Please try again later.
Looks like you have activated 3 copies of InviZible with this code already. If it is wrong, please contact the developer.
Looks like your PRO code is wrong. Please contact the developer.
You checked InviZible Pro updates more than 5 times a day. Please try again later.
Looks like this unofficial version of InviZible. Please be care of it!
InviZible Pro Project seeks your assistance. Please visit the donation page or enter the premium code you\'ve already received.
InviZible Pro Project and its author express appreciation for the assistance. Would you like to download and upgrade to PRO? The update will continue in the background.
InviZible Pro Project and its author express appreciation for the assistance!
Please configure the use of proxy server in the settings of the connected device. Default values: IP:10.1.10.1 Port:8118
Access to I2P network with Purple I2P
InviZible Pro cannot start %1$s! Please try resetting %2$s settings. If this does not help, please restart your device.
Invalid custom server configuration. Please check the SDNS field.
Please note that you have a pending purchase:
InviZible Pro Project seeks your assistance. Press OK to purchase premium features.
Sorry, but it is impossible to confirm your purchase. You will receive a refund after 3 days.
Unfortunately, this feature is available for the premium version only.

Thanks for choosing InviZible Pro. I am confident that it will enhance your privacy and provide a smooth online experience. 

	InviZible Pro includes Tor, DNSCrypt and Purple I2P as modules. 

	InviZible Pro can use root if your device is rooted, or uses a local VPN to deliver internet traffic directly to the Tor, DNSCrypt and I2P networks. 

	Privacy Policy: 
	InviZible Pro does not collect or share any personal or sensitive user data. 

	Copyright © 2019-2024 
	Garmatin Oleksandr 
	invizible.soft@gmail.com 
	invizible.net/en/privacy
Do you want to save the changes? It can break InviZible Pro.
A crash report has been discovered. Want to send it to the developer to make InviZible better?
This field can be left blank
Applications list to open directly. These applications will not use Tor or Proxy to connect to the Internet!
Please select proxy owner application at least, if you are using a local proxy.
Man-in-the-middle attack detected! Your data can be intercepted by another device on the local network. Turn off, wait a few seconds, and turn on Wi-Fi. Using current Wi-Fi hotspot may be unsafe!
ARP spoofing detection is not supported for your device!
Potential DNS Rebinding Attack Detected! Site %s has been blocked.
Do you want to save the changes?
To activate the firewall, you should start at least DNSCrypt or Tor.
Allow connections to local network, onion and i2p sites
Blocking this system app may result in an unstable internet connection!
Internet connections for newly installed apps are allowed.
Internet connections for newly installed applications are blocked.
Apps are shown regardless of whether the app can connect to the Internet or not.
Only apps that can connect to the Internet are shown.
You have added more than 3 tiles to Quick Settings. Please leave only 3. Adding more than 3 tiles can cause issues with app control.
Notifications are essential for displaying important information about the app\'s operation, app control, and detected attacks. Would you like to allow notifications for InviZible?
